document_data.name: Garoll
document_data.mainbody:
'''Garoll''' was a commoner and a frequent customer at the [[Copper Coronet]] in [[Athkatla]]'s [[Athkatla/River District|River District]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Well, I be Garoll, thank ye. '''burp''' (Who Wash at?) Now that you an' I be proper frendsh an' all, how aboutsh you buyin Garoll a drink, aye?''|Garoll}}
document_data.Description: Garoll was a [[human]] male with fair skin and brown hair who was fond green garments.
document_data.History: As of the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, Garoll could often be found drinking at the Copper Coronet. He drunkenly tried to befriend strangers asked them to buy him a drink. He was also overly-talkative about Coronet's "special" entertainment offered by the proprietor at the time, [[Lehtinan]]. When Garoll came into [[coin]] we wanted to partake in the tavern's backroom gambling on [[dog]] fights, illegal and deadly gladiatorial fights, [[opium]] trade, and prostitution.
